meanings.sent1: She became narkier when her brother kept interrupting her.
meanings.sent2: The cat looked narkier than usual when it saw the dog approaching.
meanings.sent3: The narkier squirrel scolded the birds for chirping too loudly.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds grew narkier as the wind picked up speed.
meanings.sent5: His narkier expression made it clear he was in a bad mood.

meanings.definition: Someone who complains or criticizes frequently
meanings.sent1: The narkier in the office always finds something to grumble about.
meanings.sent2: My grandma can be a bit of a narkier when things don't go her way.
meanings.sent3: The narkier at the restaurant sent back his food three times.
meanings.sent4: The narkier in the group never seems satisfied with anything.
meanings.sent5: The narkier's constant complaints made everyone avoid him.
